subtitles.text:
The gang parade, which was the largest
group of 13 people in the beginning, was
formed in 2014 and has a long history of
celebrating its 8th year this year.

There, while interviewing the members,
we will explore the gang parade from now
on.

I heard about the plan and gathered the
members.

can bring out the story of the

before.

getting a bad air.

Man?

It's not nice to meet you. It's been a

It's been a long time.
I've been managing since 2017.
I'd like to interview you this time.

I want to follow the history of Gang

I want to make sure that the individual
characteristics of each member are
properly shown.
I'm going to interview you one by one.
The first memorial service is...

Please don't call me the youngest
member.

I'd like to ask Yamanmachi Miki, the
youngest member of the Gang Parade.

First of all, the first group called

representative of our organization, was
disbanded at Yokohama Arena.
Yamanmachi Miki was on the scene.
Yes, I was in charge of Kamiya Saki.
I see.

I wasn't interested in idols at first,
but I heard from a friend that there was
a group called VISS.

When I listened to the music, it didn't
sound like an idol at all. It was rock.

I thought it was really cool, so I took
my friend to the live show.

After that, you formed a group called
PLANIME.

Then you came to the Tokyo Idol
Festival.

What kind of impression did PLANIME have
on you?
It's different from BIST.

They were dancing and singing, which was
quite shocking.
And the songs were EDM.

There weren't many EDM singers back
then, so it was very new.

And then, you were asked to join the
band,

and you announced that you would recruit
new members.
Yes, I did.
